thread.title: BARC Report Week 7: Kunal Jaisingh’s Dil Bole Oberoi gets a great start while Ssharad-Kratika’s Kasam sees a huge dip
thread.title_full: BARC Report Week 7: Kunal Jaisingh’s Dil Bole Oberoi gets a great start while Ssharad-Kratika’s Kasam sees a huge dip

author: Urmimala Banerjee
title: BARC Report Week 7: Kunal Jaisingh’s Dil Bole Oberoi gets a great start while Ssharad-Kratika’s Kasam sees a huge dip
text:
Ek Villain's Sidharth Malhotra and Shraddha Kapoor on the sets of Kumkum Bhagya - View pics! 
BARC has released its report for week 7 of 2017. This year is proving to be an exciting one for the TRPs with a number of new shows coming up. The competition is quite stiff but the top ten has its regulars. Star Plus’ ambitious project Dil Bole Oberoi has begun well and Saath Nibhaana Saathiya has also made a comeback in top 10. Four of Star Plus’ shows are in the top 10 and the channel has got back its numero uno spot. The Kapil Sharma Show rules the non-fiction category while Colors’ Rising Star is also doing well. Here is a detailed look… 
Top channels (Urban and Rural) The drama in its top shows made Star Plus the number one channel. It was followed by Colors and Rishtey. Zee TV took the fourth spot followed by Zee Anmol and Sony PAL. Sony Entertainment Television, Star Utsav, Life Ok and Sony PAL completed the list. Yeh Hai Mohabbatein, Saath Nibhaana Saathiya, Ishqbaaz and Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai did the trick for the channel. 
Top shows (Urban and Rural) Naagin 2 continued its reign while Zee TV’s Kumkum Bhagya was second followed by Rishtey’s Naagin 2. The Kapil Sharma Show, Shakti – Astitva Ke Ehsaas Ki, Saath Nibhaana Saathiya, Yeh Hai Mohabbatein and Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai took the 4th-8th ranks. Colors’ Shani and Tarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah completed the whole list. Dil Bole Oberoi entered the top 20 with its first week. (Also Read: Dil Bole Oberoi Review: Kunal Jaisingh and Rahul Dev stand out in the first episode) 
Top channels (Urban) Star Plus, Colors, Sony Entertainment Television, Life Ok, Sony SAB, Zee TV, &TV, Sony PAL, Rishtey and Star Utsav made up the list. 
Top 10 shows (Urban) Colors’ Naagin 2 took the top spot followed by Sony Entertainment Television’s The Kapil Sharma Show with Kumkum Bhagya on third place. Vivian Dsena and Rubina Dilaik’s Shakti-Astitva Ke Ehsaas Ki stayed steady on the fourth place with #KaiRaVivah helping Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai to get the fifth place. Tarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah, Yeh Hai Mohabbatein, Saath Nibhaana Saathiya, Shani and Ishqbaaz made the top 10 shows in the urban category. Ishqbaaz is climbing slowly and the channel must be rejoicing. Kasam saw a huge drop to No.20 at the bottom of the list. 
Top channels (Rural) 1. Rishtey, 2. Zee Anmol, 3. Star Utsav, 4. Sony PAL, 5. Star Plus 6. Colors, 7. Zee TV 8. Life Ok, 9. Sony Entertainment Television and 10. Big Magic. 
Top shows (Rural) It is Naagin 2 on Rishtey that took top spot followed by Zee Anmol’s Jodha Akbar and BaalVeer. Colors’ Naagin 2, Star Utsav’s Saath Nibhaana Saathiya and Kumkum Bhagya followed it. Afsar Bitiya, Naagkanya, Udaan and Tarak Mehta made the complete list. 
Well, the competition for prime time is forcing makers to think of more twists and turns. Stay tuned to Bollywood Life for more updates….
